text: Table 3 Factors important in maternal laparoscopy Use an open technique to enter the abdomen Monitor maternal end-tidal Pco, (4-4.6 kPa range) with or without arterial blood gas to avoid fetal hypercarbia and acidosis Maintain low pneumoperitoneum pressure (1.1-1.6 kPa) or use gasless technique Limit the extent of Trendelenburg or reverse Trendelenburg positions and initiate any position slowly Monitor fetal heart rate and uterine tone when feasible
